desc1.pins2: MISO_A - Programming & alternate SPI Master In Slave Out
desc1.pins3: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc2.pins2: MOSI_A - Programming & alternate SPI Master Out Slave In
desc2.pins3: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.
desc2.pins4: OC0A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc2.pins5: TXD - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output.

desc3.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc6.pins3: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc7.pins3: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc8.pins3: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc9.pins3: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc10.pins2: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)
desc10.pins3: OC0B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc11.pins2: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc12.pins4: RXD - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up.

desc14.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc16.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc17.pins3: AMP1- - Analog differential amplifier 1 input channel

desc18.pins3: AMP1+ - Analog differential amplifier 1 input channel

desc19.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.

desc21.pins1: AREF - Reference voltage for AD converter.

desc23.pins2: AMP0- - Analog differential amplifier 0 input channel

desc24.pins2: AMP0+ - Analog differential amplifier 0 input channel

desc26.pins3: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc27.pins4: ICP1B - Timer 1 input capture alternate pin

desc28.pins4: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc30.pins2: INT3 - External Interrupt source 3 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc31.pins2: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.
